snippet: Congressional Republicans stepped into the battle over an Obama administration rule requiring health insurance plans at Catholic universities and charities to offer free birth control.
abstract: Congressional Republicans forcefully enter the battle over an Obama administration rule requiring health insurance plans provided by Catholic universities and charities to offer free birth control to women; vow to fight back with legislation that unravels the policy; many republicans see the issue as a chance to unify their base in an election year.
lead_paragraph: Congressional Republicans stepped into the battle over an Obama administration rule requiring health insurance plans at Catholic universities and charities to offer free birth control.

headline.seo: Boehner Vows to Fight Contraception Rule
headline.main: Birth Control Is Covered, and G.O.P. Vows a Fight
headline.print_headline: Birth Control Is Covered, And G.O.P. Vows a Fight
